attributes.action: Allow the song 'English Rose' by Paul Weller to be England's National Anthem.
attributes.background: Due to the devolution process England needs her own National Anthem. 'English Rose' by Paul Weller is a stirring modern patriotic song and has no religious, war, Imperialism, British or royal references etc therefore will not be divisive and will be more widely acceptable and unifying.

rejection.details:
This isn’t something that the UK Government or Parliament would be able to do. There is at present no anthem for England. The use of the present National Anthem is a matter of tradition rather than having any legal or constitutional status.

You can find more information about the history and status of the national anthem here:

http://www.royal.gov.uk/MonarchUK/Symbols/NationalAnthem.aspx
